laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially showed normal sinus rhythm and no abnormalities. Two years later revealed new development of negative T waves in leads II, III, aVF, V5, and V6.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: New negative T waves developed after 2 years.

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (initial evaluation 2 years ago; repeat performed 2 years later)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial SPECT showed normal perfusion at stress and rest. Repeat SPECT revealed a large irreversible defect in the inferolateral wall, with partial reversibility in the inferior wall.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Transition from normal perfusion to a large irreversible defect over 2 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed hypokinesia in the inferolateral regions with moderate (grade 2) mitral regurgitation.
Revealed subendocardial infarction in the inferolateral wall.
Total coronary calcium score 0; no calcified plaques observed.
Revealed a proximal occlusion of the right coronary artery with retrograde filling from the left anterior descending coronary artery.
